turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about The Pied Piper (1986 film).
turn.1: What happens at the end of The Pied Piper?
turn.2: As he walks through the streets and the citizens hear him, they turn into rats and follow the sound, eventually jumping off the tower just as the rats did previously, the transformed jeweler being the last to jump.
turn.3: Is anyone else left in the city?
turn.4: The only person left is an old fisherman (who has been seen watching the city from far off earlier in the film) who comes to watch.
turn.5: Does the piper go into hiding?
turn.6: When he gets close to the piper, however, the piper ceases to exist - his cloak, now empty of a physical being inside it, is blown away with the wind.
turn.8: The fisherman walks through the now-empty city and finds a baby (who is still uncorrupted) in one of the houses.
turn.9: Does anyone else find anything else interesting?
turn.10: He takes the baby away with him and leaves the city. "The Pied Piper" was an unusually ambitious project for the production company Kratky Film, which like other animation studios in Czechoslovakia primarily made television short films for children.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.12: Research for the film took six months.
